It is intended to be an accurate reflection of those principal position elements essential for making decisions related to position performance, employee development, and compensation.

title: Principal Electrical Engineer, Embedded Systems
description:
Our client, a leader in cutting-edge technological solutions, is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Principal Electrical Engineer specializing in Embedded Systems to join their globally distributed, remote-first engineering team. This is a fully remote position, offering the flexibility to work from anywhere within the US. You will play a pivotal role in the design, development, and validation of complex embedded hardware and firmware for our next-generation products. This role demands a deep understanding of hardware-software co-design, real-time operating systems, and low-power design principles.

Responsibilities: Lead the architectural design and development of complex embedded systems, from concept to production. Develop and implement embedded firmware for microcontrollers and microprocessors, focusing on real-time performance, reliability, and efficiency. Design and lay out printed circuit boards (PCBs), ensuring adherence to signal integrity, power integrity, and EMC best practices. Specify, select, and integrate a wide range of electronic components, including processors, memory, sensors, and communication interfaces. Develop and execute comprehensive hardware and firmware test plans, including unit testing, integration testing, and system validation. Collaborate closely with software engineers, mechanical engineers, and product managers to ensure seamless integration of hardware and software components. Troubleshoot and debug complex hardware and firmware issues, identifying root causes and implementing effective solutions. Contribute to the definition of product requirements and technical specifications. Mentor junior engineers and provide technical leadership within the embedded systems domain. Stay abreast of the latest advancements in embedded systems technology, tools, and methodologies. Champion best practices in hardware design, firmware development, and testing processes. Qualifications: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field. Minimum of 10 years of progressive experience in embedded systems design and development. Proven expertise in C/C++ programming for embedded environments and low-level driver development. Extensive experience with microcontroller architectures (e.g., ARM Cortex-M, RISC-V) and associated development tools. Strong proficiency in schematic capture and PCB layout tools (e.g., Altium Designer, Cadence). In-depth knowledge of real-time operating systems (RTOS), interrupt handling, and power management techniques. Experience with various communication protocols (e.g., SPI, I2C, UART, USB, Ethernet, Bluetooth, Wi-Fi). Familiarity with hardware debugging tools, including oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, and JTAG debuggers. Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and debugging skills. Strong communication and collaboration skills, essential for a remote team environment. Experience with embedded Linux or other advanced embedded operating systems is a significant plus. Demonstrated leadership capabilities and a passion for mentoring others. This is a fully remote position. Our client values collaboration and innovation and seeks individuals who are self-motivated and thrive in a distributed work environment.

title: Senior Hardware Design Engineer - Embedded Systems
description:
Our client is at the forefront of developing cutting-edge electronic devices and is seeking a highly skilled Senior Hardware Design Engineer to join their fully remote engineering team. This role is integral to the design, development, and verification of complex embedded hardware systems. The ideal candidate will possess deep expertise in schematic capture, PCB layout, signal integrity, power integrity, and hardware bring-up. You will be responsible for the entire hardware development lifecycle, from conceptualization and requirements definition through to production support. This includes selecting components, designing complex multi-layer PCBs, performing rigorous design reviews, and overseeing the fabrication and assembly process. A significant part of this role involves working collaboratively with firmware and software engineers to ensure seamless integration of hardware and software components. You will conduct detailed simulations and analyses to predict and optimize performance, reliability, and manufacturability. This is a remote-first position, demanding excellent communication, collaboration, and self-management skills. The successful candidate will be adept at working independently, managing their time effectively, and contributing significantly to a distributed team environment. Experience with high-speed digital interfaces, microcontrollers, FPGAs, and power management circuits is essential. We are looking for a proactive problem-solver with a passion for innovation and a commitment to delivering high-quality, robust hardware solutions. This is an exceptional opportunity to shape the future of our client's product offerings and contribute to groundbreaking technological advancements from anywhere.

Key Responsibilities:
Design and develop complex embedded hardware systems, including schematic capture and PCB layout. Perform thorough signal integrity and power integrity analyses. Select appropriate components and evaluate their performance and availability. Oversee PCB fabrication, assembly, and testing processes. Conduct hardware bring-up, debugging, and system-level testing. Collaborate closely with firmware and software engineers for hardware-software integration. Develop and execute comprehensive verification and validation test plans. Document designs, test results, and manufacturing guidelines. Troubleshoot and resolve hardware-related issues throughout the product lifecycle. Stay current with emerging hardware design trends and technologies. Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field. Minimum of 8 years of experience in embedded hardware design. Proficiency with EDA tools (e.g., Altium Designer, Cadence Allegro). Strong understanding of signal and power integrity principles. Experience with microcontrollers, FPGAs, and various communication interfaces (e.g., USB, Ethernet, SPI, I2C). Familiarity with test equipment (oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, spectrum analyzers). Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills. Proven ability to work effectively in a remote, collaborative environment.

title: Electrical and Firmware Engineer
description:
Electrical and Firmware Engineer Job Description

We're Impulse. We're a team of engineers, designers and innovators based in San Francisco who believe making good decisions for your home and the environment should not come at a cost to your lifestyle. We're dedicated to building delightful, high-performance products for everyday needs that enable rewarding, long-term, scalable solutions for whole-home electrification.

We're looking for individuals excited to join an early-stage, VC-backed growing company with powerful aspirations to make positive change in a major industry - come build with us!
About the role:

We are seeking a talented Electrical Engineer to join our hardware development team. The ideal candidate combines strong theoretical foundations with hands‑on expertise in digital circuit design, sensor integration, and firmware development. This role requires someone who thrives in the lab environment and can take designs from concept through production. The position also requires ability to architect and direct the work of design and manufacturing partners often outside the US.

You will design and develop digital circuits and sensor interfaces for next‑generation products, working closely with cross‑functional teams to define requirements and deliver robust hardware solutions. You'll be responsible for circuit design, schematic capture, PCB layout direction, and thorough verification of designs through prototype bring‑up and testing. The role includes writing and debugging firmware for embedded systems, conducting detailed failure analysis, and collaborating with manufacturing partners to ensure designs transition smoothly to production.
Required Qualifications

Education & Experience:
• BS in Electrical Engineering with 5+ years of relevant experience, or MS with 3+ years.

Technical Skills:
• Demonstrated expertise in digital circuit design including microcontrollers and high‑speed digital interfaces.
• Proven experience designing sensor interfaces (ADCs, signal conditioning, multi‑sensor systems).
• Strong firmware development skills in C/C++ for embedded systems with experience writing clean, maintainable code.
• Ability to write test automation scripts (typically Python) for controlling test equipment using SCPI and other industry‑standard protocols.
• Proficiency with standard EE tools including oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, spectrum analyzers, and power supplies.

Lab Skills:
• Excellent hands‑on debugging and troubleshooting abilities.
• Experience with board bring‑up, signal integrity measurements, and design validation.
• Comfortable working independently in the lab to isolate and resolve complex hardware issues.
Preferred Qualifications
• Superb EE fundamentals.
• Experience with high‑speed digital design.
• Experience with interfacing MCUs to analog sensors.
• Experience working with Joint Development Manufacturers (JDMs) or contract manufacturers through the product development lifecycle, including design for manufacturability considerations and production support.
• Experience writing production‑quality firmware.
What's in it for you:

Meaningful equity in a fast‑moving company with top investors. Generous benefits include health, vision, dental, commuter, and fitness. The opportunity to work on an actually cool technology product.

title: Senior Electrical Engineer - Embedded Systems
description:
Our client, a fast-growing technology firm in **Provo, Utah, US**, is seeking a highly skilled Senior Electrical Engineer with deep expertise in embedded systems design. This role is integral to the development of cutting-edge hardware and software integrated products. You will be responsible for the entire lifecycle of embedded systems, from concept and schematic design through to prototyping, testing, and production support. The ideal candidate possesses a strong understanding of microcontroller architectures, digital and analog circuit design, firmware development, and board bring-up. You will collaborate closely with software engineers, mechanical engineers, and product managers to deliver innovative and reliable electronic solutions.

Responsibilities: Design, develop, and test complex embedded systems and electronic circuits. Select appropriate microcontrollers, processors, FPGAs, and other components for various applications. Create detailed schematics and PCB layouts using industry-standard EDA tools (e.g., Altium Designer, Cadence Allegro). Develop and debug firmware using C/C++ for embedded microcontrollers and real-time operating systems (RTOS). Perform board bring-up, system integration, and performance testing. Conduct signal integrity, power integrity, and thermal analysis for electronic designs. Collaborate with software teams to define hardware-software interfaces and ensure seamless integration. Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation, including design specifications, test reports, and user manuals. Troubleshoot hardware and firmware issues, identify root causes, and implement effective solutions. Stay current with the latest advancements in embedded systems technology, microcontrollers, sensors, and communication protocols. Assist in transitioning designs from R&D to manufacturing, ensuring manufacturability and testability. Mentor junior electrical engineers and contribute to the team's technical growth. Participate in design reviews and provide constructive feedback. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field. Master's degree is preferred. Minimum of 6 years of experience in electrical engineering, with a strong focus on embedded systems design. Proven experience in schematic capture, PCB layout, and board bring-up. Proficiency in embedded C/C++ programming and debugging. Experience with various microcontrollers (e.g., ARM Cortex-M, PIC, AVR) and real-time operating systems (RTOS). Strong understanding of digital logic, analog circuit design, power management, and communication protocols (e.g., I2C, SPI, UART, USB, Ethernet). Experience with test equipment such as oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, and spectrum analyzers. Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and troubleshooting skills. Strong communication and teamwork abilities. Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git). Experience with FPGAs or signal processing is a plus. This is an excellent opportunity for a seasoned electrical engineer to contribute to the development of innovative products in a dynamic environment. Our client offers a competitive salary and benefits package.

title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer - IoT
description:
Our client, a leading innovator in smart home technology and Internet of Things (IoT) solutions, is seeking a highly skilled Senior Embedded Software Engineer to join their fully remote team. This role is critical in designing, developing, and implementing sophisticated embedded software for our next-generation IoT devices. The ideal candidate will possess extensive experience in C/C++, real-time operating systems (RTOS), microcontroller programming, and wireless communication protocols. You will be responsible for the entire software development lifecycle, from requirements gathering and architecture design to coding, testing, debugging, and deployment, all within a collaborative, remote-first environment. Your expertise will drive the innovation and performance of our connected products, ensuring reliability, security, and seamless user experiences.

Key Responsibilities: Design, develop, test, and maintain embedded software for IoT devices using C/C++. Implement and manage real-time operating systems (RTOS) for resource-constrained environments. Develop firmware for microcontrollers (e.g., ARM Cortex-M series) and other embedded processors. Integrate and optimize wireless communication protocols such as Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Zigbee, and LoRaWAN. Implement robust security measures to protect IoT devices and data. Collaborate with hardware engineers to define hardware requirements and resolve integration issues. Perform code reviews, unit testing, and system integration testing to ensure high-quality software. Debug and troubleshoot complex software and system issues. Optimize embedded software for performance, power consumption, and memory usage. Contribute to the definition of software architecture and design patterns. Stay current with emerging technologies and best practices in embedded systems and IoT. Work effectively in a distributed team environment, using agile methodologies. Qualifications: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field. Minimum of 7 years of experience in embedded software development. Proficiency in C/C++ programming for embedded systems. Strong experience with Real-Time Operating Systems (RTOS) such as FreeRTOS, Zephyr, or similar. In-depth knowledge of microcontroller architectures and peripherals. Experience with wireless communication protocols (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Zigbee, etc.). Familiarity with IoT platforms and cloud connectivity. Understanding of software security principles for embedded systems. Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and build tools. Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and debugging skills. Strong communication and collaboration skills, essential for a remote team. Experience with hardware-software integration and debugging tools (e.g., JTAG, oscilloscopes). Join a forward-thinking company that is shaping the future of connected living and enjoy the flexibility of a fully remote role.

title: Senior Firmware Engineer
description:
Clientmind Recruiting is searching for a Senior Firmware Engineer for a growing technology company in Greenbelt, MD. This role is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining firmware and software in various applications. This is a full-time position and will work onsite 3x per week.

Tasks

Responsibilities:

Firmware Development: Design, develop, and maintain embedded firmware for a variety of microcontroller-based systems, ensuring optimal performance, reliability, and power efficiency.

• Architecture & Design: Collaborate in defining system architecture and firmware design, including low-level driver development for sensors and I/O interfaces, hardware abstraction layers, and communication protocols.

• Debugging & Troubleshooting: Identify, diagnose, and resolve complex firmware and system issues, utilizing tools such as oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, and debuggers.

• Code Optimization: Optimize firmware for performance, memory usage, and power consumption while adhering to real-time and safety-critical requirements.

• Collaboration & Communication: Work closely with hardware engineers, software teams, and product managers to ensure seamless integration of firmware with hardware and system-level applications.

• Documentation: Produce high-quality documentation, including specifications, design documents, test plans, and user manuals to support firmware development and maintenance.

• Testing & Validation: Develop and execute unit tests, integration tests, and system-level validation to ensure firmware quality and robustness.

• Mentorship: Provide technical leadership and mentorship to junior and mid-level engineers, guiding them in best practices and solving complex engineering challenges.

• Continuous Improvement: Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in embedded systems, firmware development techniques, and industry trends, and contribute to the improvement of engineering practices.

Requirements

Required Qualifications:

• Clearance: US Citizen with Secret level security clearance or ability and willingness to obtain a clearance.

• Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.

• Experience: Minimum of 8+ years of hands-on experience in embedded firmware development with a proven track record of successful project execution.

• Technical Skills:

o Strong proficiency in C/C++ programming languages for embedded systems.

o Extensive experience with microcontrollers (e.g., ARM Cortex-M, STM32), including hardware-level programming and peripheral interfacing.

o Expertise in both bare metal and RTOS (Real-Time Operating Systems) embedded software architectures.

o Experience with communication protocols such as UART, SPI, I2C, CAN, Ethernet, etc.

o Proficient with debugging tools such as JTAG, oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, and IDE debuggers.

o Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git, SVN).

• Problem-Solving: Strong analytical skills with the ability to diagnose and resolve complex embedded system issues.

• Documentation: Ability to produce clear, concise documentation and reports.

• Collaboration: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.

Preferred Qualifications:

• Advanced Experience: Experience with FPGA development, low-level hardware design, or system-on-chip (SoC) integration.

• Embedded Linux: Experience programming on custom embedded Linux platforms running on embedded application processors. Familiarity with building custom Linux features and power/speed optimization.

• Software Skills: Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python) for automation or testing purposes.
